title: Who is the number 1 K-Pop girl group today? - Quora

response.answer_text: Right from the beginning, girl bands have been dominating much of the music scene. Talking about the the ’90s era, bands such as Sugababes, Pussycat Dolls, and Girls Aloud came and went, leaving us with Fifth Harmony, Little Mix, and many others. There is no arguing with the fact that K-Pop has fascinated the world and even more so now by captivating international fans. Each band has a story to tell. If you are a k-pop lover, make sure check out these 5 K-Pop girl bands. Let’s take a look at them. 1.S.E.S: Throughout the K-Pop music culture, S.E.S is a well-known girl band. Rising to fame in the late ’90s and continuing their success through to the early 2000s, they are well respected and regarded as the first K-Pop girl band to become famous. In Korea, the band released six albums and five albums in Japan, showcasing their talent.  2.Fin.K.L: Popularly known as the Fin Killing Liberty, it is against the oppression of all freedom. However, it was suggested that the record company had more to do with the decision rather than the girls themselves. From R’n’B ballad ‘Blue Rain’ to sweet dance tune ‘Eternal Love‘ to hit ‘Now.’ the band captured their fans through their diverse use of music genres. Even though they became popular among the public, the members of the band stated on different occasions. 3.Wonder Girls: This South Korean girl band most likely served as an international introduction to K-Pop, as they were one of the few K-Pop bands that scored a hit on the Billboard Hot 100, reaching No. 76 with their hit ‘Nobody.’ Wonder Girls have not produced any more albums; however, the record label insists they have not split up. 4.After School: They are the only K-Pop band first to introduce admission and graduation concept. Coming to this system, members are added or withdrawn in a ‘natural’ manner. This girl band stands out as entertainers who give live performances, making them the center of attraction on every occasion. 5.Baby V.O.X: Even though they are officially no longer a group, this five-member dance group is popular and are representative of K-Pop. Unfortunately, not all of the seven albums were a success, and as per the sources it has been stated that it was the main reason for their split. After that, the girl band broke into Chinese music charts as well, and this breakthrough helped them spread across Asia. As you could see, these are a few of the top K-Pop girls band. If you love listening to k-pop music, try listening to these bands. You can also buy here Catchop CD.

2NE1 handsdown. They create new trends in music, fashion and concepts each time they release something new. They are the only girl band who helps in producing their album esp their group leader CL. They have covered many genres of music such as soul, ballad, pop, RnB, hip-hop, reggae, jazz, rock, electronic, punk, etc unlike other K-Pop girl groups. Most of their soul, RnB, Ballad, etc music has very good lyrics with deep and sometimes profound meanings. They have timeless quality to it, meaning you can hear it even 10/20 yrs from now on and it won't feel dated. Their music overall is not teeny candyfloss bubblegum pop with only current value which is not bad but too generic and over produced in S. Korea atm. 2NE1 saves girl band music and serious- mature listener don't have to look down upon girl band music because of them and appreciate their music. They are artists before they are an Idol as compared to other K-Pop girlbands out there. They have the best live stage ever. No girl group comes close to them in live performances. You will get goosebumps if you see their live stages even if you are not their fan. See this ''I am the BEST'' live performance from MAMA 2011. Till date I haven't seen any national/ international/ Korean performance as powerful as this.  Each of the members has their own strong personality and individual colour. They have their distinct style from each other and do not look uniformed or carbon-copy of each other. Their voices are also different and unique. They have won more international awards and recognition than any other K-Pop girl bands which itself shows that they are well revered as a K-Pop force in other parts of the world. They have charted in world billboard charts in top 10.  Their stages are always sold out. Even in their domestic performances, if you see any award functions/ shows, their live stages become the main USP and highlight of the night.  Overall they are the Bee Eee Ess Tee.
